name: Rancho Pacifico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a sentence, RP is generally very good with some quirks and minor issues.
reviews.title: In a sentence, RP is generally very good with some quirks.
Dream Honeymoon
reviews.text: We stayed at RP for 8 days, Friday to Saturday, December 2-10 (most of the other guests we met had shorter stays). We flew into San Jose on December 1st and stayed overnight at the Hampton Inn at the airport (which I have also reviewd on tripadvisor). The next morning we took a taxi to Tobias Bolaños International Airport for our Nature Air flight. Note that this airport is about 10 miles away from the Juan Santamaria International Airport, which is a 30 minute to 1 hour trip (depending on traffic) from Juan Santamaria, as compared to Sansa Air which flies out of Juan Santamaria Airport. While Nature Air plans to move its operations to Juan Santamaria Airport in the future, until that happens you may want to consider taking Sansa Air instead to avoid the additional travel (and taxi cost). There was a huge traffic jam en route to Tobia Bolanos Airport, but we arrived 45 minutes later thanks to some taxi driver heroics and were able to board our plane on time. Once we arrived at the airport in Quepos, we had to wait about 15 minutes for the driver from RP who was a bit late. He apologized for the delay and was very nice. The ride from Quepos to RP is about 1 hour, most of it on good paved roads. The unpaved road up to the lodge is very bumpy and you will probably not want to drive it more than once or twice a day. It's walkable but difficult because it is very steep and unstable with loose gravel and rocks (although we regularly saw Garrison the owner and Tito the min pin making daily walks on the road). The driver offered to stop at the supermarket on the way to the lodge and we stopped and bought some fruit and trail mix and beer. Particularly if you plan on sticking around the lodge for most meals, we recommend stocking up on beverages and snacks-

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we arrived we were greeted by glasses of fresh tropical juice. We stayed in a second floor luxury spa suite which was a good size, and had a coffee maker, small fridge (which we had a little trouble with - it stopped working a few times but was fixed by the staff) with two refillable bottles of purified water, an armoire, and a sitting area with a small futon-like sofa, two leather armchairs and two coffee tables. Note that unlike the first floor spa room, the second floor does not have an additional outdoor space other than the balcony (the first floor appears to have a patio). Two pairs of shades in the particular room we stayed in were decorative only - they did not extend fully down to cover the window, which meant no privacy from the villa next to us, which had a view through our room and into our balcony (and the soaking tub). The balcony had two small chairs and a soaking tub with some tealights. There were two suites in the building we stayed in, and it was possible to hear the occupants in the suite dowstairs (and I'm sure they could hear us upstairs). All of the windows have glass that closes but the door to the balcony is a screen door only.
reviews.title: Stunning in every way

reviews.text: The bathroom has a large modern "trough" style sink with two faucets, and a two person shower that is open to the balcony outside. There are two sets of curtains separating the shower from the outside and the rest of the bathroom. Note that this means the bathroom is completely open to the outside although private, which we enjoyed but might not be right for everyone. On the one hand it makes for a unique back to nature experience, taking a shower with the sounds of the jungle. On the other hand, not having the option of closing off the bathroom from the outdoors means some insects (although fewer than expected) and jungle visitors. The open bathroom concept may be unique to the luxury spa suite, as the villas and tree houses have similar showers but with screens.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeeping staff clean the rooms during the day and leave a special sheet covering the bed linens to minimize any dampness from the humidity with fresh flowers arranged on the bed. A night maid comes by during dinner to remove the sheet and prepare the bed for sleeping. The housekeeping staff was very thorough and always replaced the coffee and other essentials during our stay. The toiletries were Biolandia except for the soaps which I believe are handmade in Costa Rica, if I recall correctly. Our room and bathroom were quite lovely but for those of you who may be mindful about this sort of thing, the quality of the bed linens, furnishings, hardware, etc. in the room and bathroom, while perfectly nice, was not super luxurious or high end (note this may not be the case for the rooms at higher price points like the tree house or villas).
reviews.title: Things to consider for this property

reviews.text: The experience is spectacular. From the moment you are picked up in San Jose, you become part of the RP family. While RP draws mostly honeymooners and couples on their anniversary it seems, I enjoyed a mother-daughter trip and felt very welcome. The beauty of the place can hardly be put into words. The location is stunning and private. You really have to experience it - falling asleep to rain, waking to the distant sounds of monkeys, discovering the flora and fauna, seeing the clouds roll in and engulfing you and the mountains, watching the toucans in flight, exploring the rainforest and walking to the waterfall, indulging in the outdoor spa. The accomodations are lovely - fresh coffee, nice bedding, and a lovely bathroom with a shower that opens to the rainforest. Most of all, it was the staff that won my heart! A few tips: first, the road leading up to RP is steep, curvy, and requires an off-road vehicle. We were so thankful we chose RP for transportation rather than renting a car. Also, we visited in early November. Rain came every day, sometimes all day, but that was part of the wonderful experience! When you read "rainy season" trust that there will be rain. We loved our experience, every bit of it.
reviews.title: Genuine Place and People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 5 spectacular nights here in September to celebrate our 25th anniversary. I wanted to choose somewhere super fantastic for this milestone, and we were not disappointed! The resort is simply stunning, perched "al cielo" (as the taxi driver we asked for directions told us) above the jungle and at the edge of the rain forest. Expansive views of the ocean and Whale's Tail emphasize just how high up the boutique property is. The rooms (we were fortunate enough to stay in more than one) feature high-style contemporary design mixed with a casual ease using natural materials which creates a very easy, relaxed sense of super luxury. The bathrooms are fantastic! Each of ours had decks outside the showers. Each of the rooms we had took advantage of the surrounding natural beauty and the views. Waking to the sounds of howler monkeys each morning, along with the calls of toucans..... we knew we were somewhere exotic.
reviews.title: Surpassed every expectation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Matching the impressive design of the resort -- even surpassing it? -- the service was top-notch from the moment we arrived (in a torrential rain storm). Every one of the members of the staff treated us with the greatest warmth, attention and genuine hospitality. We've traveled many places around the world and can honestly say that the superior level of attention here is truly impressive: not once did we feel that any request was a burden, nor did we feel that the warmth was disingenuous. We're not demanding people, and appreciate a more 'balanced' level of service: present, willing and friendly but not overobsequious. The staff, all around, took extra steps to ensure our time there was as perfect as could be. And we are grateful!
reviews.title: Beyond All Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition, it should be noted that there is a beautiful waterfall on the property -- a very nice hike (more challenging in the rain!). We enjoyed breakfasts and dinners at the resort and took off most afternoons for activities in the area. [I would highly recommend the 'National Geographic' tour, although it has absolutely nothing to do with NatGeo.] The dining area is lovely and affords lofty views of the ocean and Whale's Tail below.
reviews.title: Mountain-ocean luxury retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only hope we can put into words what an amazing retreat Rancho Pacifico is. Up on top of a mountain, and in the rainforest, what more can someone ask for? The views were so beautiful, the rooms were first class and if that was not enough the ENTIRE staff attended to our every want. They are fun, caring, genuine and like the family that you will miss when you leave. This wonderful resort is the 'total package' and it went above and beyond all of our expectations.Not many get this opportunity to experience this exceptional piece of paradise,and we will always appreciate the fact that we did. We would go back in a heart beat and recommed it without hesitation.
reviews.title: Very nice, but a week is too long

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rancho Pacifico was the highlight of our trip to Costa Rica. This beautiful hotel is a very special place to stay - a very peaceful and relaxing hotel with genuinely excellent service. Not much choice on the menu (which changed every day) but the food was always excellent. Would love to go back!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: This resort and spa gives you the opportunity to experience the rainforest of Costa Rica with the highest quality of service and dining. Nestled up in the mountains with unbelieveable views of the Pacific, you can enjoy the wildlife and nature that surrounds you. The beach is a short trip down the mountain and the staff is available to take you in the four WD. The villas are open-air and spacious. We are already talking about our next trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic and we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to Rancho Pacifico on the first leg of our Honeymoon. I wish we went there on the last leg because all the other hotels were a disappointment after staying here. The views are beautiful, the food is great, and the service is one of a kind. If you are looking for a hotel that is truely unique and away from the fast pace corporate life, then Rancho Pacifico is your place.
reviews.title: Great Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rancho Pacifico is a spectacular place in a fairy tale setting in the Costa Rican rain forest. Everything you could possibly want for a peaceful and relaxing vacation is there...or the staff will make it available for you. We stayed 9 nights in the upper Tree house. Each morning we awakened to the sounds of the birds and monkeys. While the staff is pleased to arrange day trips for hiking, horse back riding, zip-lining over the rain forest canopy, etc we were so happy with the hotel that we ventured out only twice, once to the nearby beach to walk the "whale's tale" and on a fantastic National Geographic river boat trip to see more monkeys, birds and caymans.
reviews.title: 5 stars for service....and service recovery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise we "spa-ed" every day with Marco and Vivien and enjoyed leisurely breakfasts and lunches in the beautiful dining room looking out over the pool and coast line. Cocktail hour each night was accompanied by hors d'ouevres and good fellowship. We were pleased with the eclectic mix of guests of all ages from honeymooners to retired corporate executives. No more than 20 guests were present in the entire property during our stay.Evening meals prepared by RP's expert staff directed by Chef Alex were superb in all aspects...creativity, choices, portion size and most of all taste. The wine list is varied and represents real value in South and Central American vintages. The servers were professional and friendly. We were always greeted by name and really developed a relationship with the staff during the stay. This didn't require great effort on our part since the staff was so forthcoming and friendly.
reviews.title: Magnificent Boutique Resort - Special and Unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rancho Pacifico is not for everyone, and they have a great page on their website explaining the difference between their resort and others in Costa Rica. We were looking for a place not so commercial, where we could still get top notch service, and have more privacy. If those things are high on your priority list, then I can absolutely recommend RP. From the first day we arrived, until our departure, the staff made it clear that they were there to fulfill any request we made. From the course-by-course serving of some of our meals in our villa, to arranging activities, they went over and above, to ensure they exceed our expectations. The menus were prepared each day, and the food was excellent. The best way I can describe our overall experience is that we felt like we owned a resort, and had a staff of people working for us each day. A home away from home that just happened to be a luxury resort in the middle of the rain forest. Can't beat that.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are insufficient superlatives to describe just how wonderful RP is. The staff are wonderful, the SPA treatments are excellent, the food is delicious and the location is beautiful. RP is eco-tourism at its best. If you decide that RP is for you we recommend the following.
reviews.title: Honeymoon - 24-31 August

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did two hikes from RP itself into the rainforest. The first down to RP's private waterfall, the second up to the top of the mountain into the side of which RP is built. We encountered myriad plants, birds, insects, mammals, amphibians and spiders (including Howler monkeys, Toucans, a tarantula, a spider hunting wasp, leaf-cutter ants, tree frogs and more).
reviews.title: BEST SERVICE!

reviews.text: RP can also arrange a "birding" tour. I cannot recommend this highly enough. We did a 6hr walk at the nearby Hacienda Baru with an experienced guide who helped us to spot wildlife (birds and others). It was a great experience.
reviews.title: Of course there are bugs; it's the rainforest!

reviews.text: RP will help you to taylor your visit to your preferences and you will leave feeling "Pura Vida!"
reviews.title: Perfection and seclusion in the Costa Rican mountains.

description: Rancho Pacifico - Where Style meets Nature and the Rainforest meets the sea. Member - Small Luxury Hotels of the World. Deluxe Villas, Suites, & TreeHaus', Jungle Spa, Private Preserve and secluded beaches. Spectacular ocean views and spacious privacy in Costa Rica's last best place. World Travel Award Triple Nominee - Leading Boutique and Leading Green Hotel, Central and Latin America, 6 consecutive years.
